page.title: 06Adisham School, and Customs
page.content: The Church Primary School takes up to seventy children, juniors and infants aged five to eleven years. They have three teachers with an additional teacher on two days. The school has two prefabricated classrooms added. The village hall is used for gym, and dinners provided from Littlebourne. After leaving primary school pupils travel to Aylesham for Senior School or into Canterbury to Grammar Schools. Some children attend private schools. The school holds no traditional festi- vals but shares in those held at the Church. Children join in the village customs of Mayday with May Queen and procession and Beating the Bounds of the parish boundary, both held about every five years. The Baptist Sunday School has a bonfire on 5th November. Witches are said to have been held in Bossington House awaiting trial.
